headline.main: BRITISH SHIPS SHELL PANTELLERIA TWICE AS PLANES POUND IT; Island Garrison Reported on Alert for Invasion Seen as Imminent by Italians FLEET SUFFERS NO LOSS Weak Reply Made by Shore Guns -- Fortresses and Lightnings Range Mediterranean SEA AND AIR ARMS POUND ITALIAN ISLE BRITISH SHIPS SHELL PANTELLERIA TWICE

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, June 2 -- The mightiest sea and air weapons in the Mediterranean theatre -- the British fleet and American Air Force -- combined their forces to batter Italy's tiny island fortress of Pantelleria with hundreds of tons of bombs and shells yesterday.
abstract: 2,000 tons of Allied bombs dropped on Italy in wk
